title: Barratt Developments profits buoyed by strong house sales in the North
text:
Barratt Developments profits buoyed by strong house sales in the North The Newcastle-established company said it has a strong six months, with profits up to £321m Share Get business updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Strong house sales in the North of England have helped cement a healthy six months of trading for housebuilder Barratt Developments . 
The firm has reported a healthy rise in half-year profits after notching up a large number of completions outside London, citing particularly strong regional sales performances in the North, Scotland, North West and West Midlands. 
The Newcastle-founded firm said pre-tax profits rose 8.8% to £321m in the six months to December 31, despite revenue falling 3.2% to £1.8bn. 
Director David Thomas said: “We have delivered another very strong first-half performance, pre-tax profits were up nearly 9% and completions outside of London at their highest level in nine years.” 
Total completions were down 5.8% to 7,180 with a slowing property market in London dragging on performance. 
Completions in London came in at 367 versus 842 in the same period last year, although Barratt expects sales in the capital to pick up in the second half of the year. Signs on a Barratt Developments site (Photo: PA) 
Mr Thomas said: “With a record forward order book, strong consumer demand and a positive lending backdrop, we remain confident in our outlook for the full year. Read More Durham's £30m luxury student scheme prepares to open with sauna, roof terrace and sky lounge 
“Our confidence in the business going forward is reflected in the improved and extended capital return plan.” 
The group said the “fundamentals” of the housing market remain robust, with strong demand supported by good mortgage availability and the Help to Buy scheme. Read More Tech leader Kromek announces $3.1m deal with US security screening firm 
The housebuilder hiked its interim dividend 22% to 7.3p. 
Shares in Barratt rose 1.65% to 523p in morning trading and George Salmon, equity analyst at Hargreaves Lansdown, said: “Up to now, the UK’s housebuilders have generally espoused a tone of cautious optimism following the Brexit vote. 
“Barratt Developments has this morning gone a step beyond, and has adopted a more aggressive dividend policy. 
“The extension of the group’s generous capital returns plan is certainly eye-catching, but the decision to pay out a higher proportion of earnings in the ordinary dividend is just as much of a sign of its confidence.” Like us on Facebook
